newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Grolsch raises stake in Polish brewer.
newsitem.headline: Grolsch raises stake in Polish brewer.

text.p: Brewer Grolsch NV said on Tuesday the Polish state had sold almost all of its remaining stake in Elbrewery to Brewpole BV in which Grolsch has a 25 percent equity stake.

A Grolsch spokesman said the deal would raise Brewpole's stake in Elbrewery to almost 98 percent from 51 percent, adding that Brewpole expected to buy the remaining shares in Elbrewery from the Polish government soon.
The spokesman declined to give financial details of the transaction but said that Australian investors held most of the shares in Brewpole.
Grolsch described Elbrewery as the market leader in Poland where it is mainly known for its EB brand. Elbrewery also brews and distributes Grolsch Premium Pilsner in Poland.
Grolsch said the Polish beer market was one of the fastest growing in Europe, posting nine percent growth in 1995 and likely to show further expansion in 1996 despite a poor summer.
Given the seasonal pattern of beer sales, Brewpole's increased stake in Elbrewery at this point in the year would have little effect on Grolsch's 1996 results, it said.
Grolsch has consolidated Brewpole's results in its own figures in proportion to its holding since 1995.
